subject: RE: [junit] awkward mocking options.
msgSnippet: ... Or you could wrap acces to the ServiceLocator into a Strategy. I think I d actually prefer the latter. Cheers, Ilja
messageBody:
Ilja Preuss wrote:
> Kevin O'Sullivan wrote:
>
>> 1. Have my own ServiceLocator which return mock objects, and get this
>> ServiceLocator on the classpath before the 'real one' - but I hate
>> depening on classpath loading order, mostly because its a bit of a
>> dark art to me.
>
> Eeek. I wouldn't do this.
>
>> 2. Modify ServiceLocator to add a member variable to say if its
>> operating under junit test or real production. If its a junit test,
>> then it should return a mock object (that I can set), otherwise
>> return the real thing. This would involve an extra "if (junit)" in
>> all the getServiceClient() methods, and it seems like a lot of extra
>> work.
>
> You could use the Status/Strategy pattern instead of the if's.

Or you could wrap acces to the ServiceLocator into a Strategy. I think
I'd actually prefer the latter.

Cheers, Ilja
